QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Movement - uncoordinated
QAPair.Answer: Uncoordinated movement is due to a muscle control problem that causes an inability to coordinate movements. It leads to a jerky, unsteady, to-and-fro motion of the middle of the body (trunk) and an unsteady gait (walking style). It can also affect the limbs. The medical name of this condition is ataxia.
